articles.author: MATTHEW BROWN Associated Press
articles.title: As wildfires get worse, smoke spreads, stokes health worries
articles.description: Increasingly intense wildfires that have scorched forests from California to
articles.content:
PARADISE, Calif. -- 
First came the flames, a raging firestorm propelled by 50 mph (80 kph) wind gusts that incinerated Kelsey Nortons house and killed 85 people in her community.
Then came the smoke not just from the forest but also from some 14,000 houses… [+9375 chars]

articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.title: Bus catches fire in road accident in India; at least 20 dead
articles.description: Police say a double-decker bus has caught fire after ramming into a truck on a highway in northern India and 20 people are feared dead
articles.content:
LUCKNOW, India -- 
At least 20 people died when a double-decker bus caught fire after ramming into a truck on a highway in northern India, police said.
Another 21 people were taken to a hospital, some of them in critical condition, following the crash late … [+804 chars]

articles.title: AP Explains: Taiwan's election and its standoff with China
articles.description: Taiwanese are casting their votes Saturday for the president and legislature of a self-governing island that acts like a sovereign nation yet is not recognized by the U.N. or any major country
articles.content:
TAIPEI, Taiwan -- 
Taiwanese are casting their votes Saturday for the president and legislature of a self-governing island that acts like a sovereign nation yet is not recognized by the U.N. or any major country. 
China regards Taiwan, which lies 160 kilome… [+3274 chars]

articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.title: 7 countries lose vote in UN General Assembly over arrears
articles.description: The United Nations says seven countries are so far behind in paying their dues that they are losing their voting privileges in the 193-member General Assembly, including Venezuela and Lebanon
articles.content:
UNITED NATIONS -- 
The United Nations says seven countries are so far behind in paying their dues that they are losing their voting privileges in the 193-member General Assembly, including Venezuela and Lebanon.
U.N. spokesman Stephane Dujarric said Friday … [+849 chars]

articles.author: Justin Doom, Marc Nathanson
articles.title: Iran 'unintentionally' shot down Ukrainian plane: Associated Press
articles.description: Iran admitted that it unintentionally shot down a Ukrainian jet.
articles.content:
Iran "unintentionally" shot down a Ukrainian jet, killing all 176 aboard, according to The Associated Press.
The statement was broadcast on Iranian state TV, citing a statement from the military.
Released Saturday morning in Tehren, the statement blamed "hu… [+70 chars]

articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.title: Iran says it 'unintentionally' shot down Ukrainian jetliner
articles.description: Iranian state TV, citing a military statement, says the country ‘unintentionally’ shot down a Ukrainian jetliner, killing all 176 aboard
articles.content:
TEHRAN, Iran -- 
Iran announced Saturday that its military unintentionally shot down a Ukrainian jetliner, killing all 176 aboard. 
The statement came Saturday morning and blamed human error for the shootdown.
The jetliner, a Boeing 737 operated by Ukraini… [+532 chars]

articles.title: Iran state TV, citing military, says country 'unintentionally' shot down Ukrainian jetliner because of human error
articles.description: Iran state TV, citing military, says country 'unintentionally' shot down Ukrainian jetliner because of human error
articles.content:
TEHRAN, Iran -- 
Iran state TV, citing military, says country 'unintentionally' shot down Ukrainian jetliner because of human error.

articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.title: China reports 1st death from new type of coronavirus
articles.description: Health authorities in the central Chinese city of Wuhan are reporting the first death from a new type of coronavirus
articles.content:
BEIJING -- 
Health authorities in the central Chinese city of Wuhan are reporting the first death from a new type of coronavirus. 
The Wuhan Municipal Health Commission reported Saturday that seven other people were in critical condition.
